item.title: Beocord 9000: Display Restoration with SMD LEDs
item.description: The Beocord 9000 being restored has a common issue: a faulty 7-segment display. While only one segment was out, these large, early LED displays are a key design element, making repair essential. This display resembles the Beomaster 8000’s frequency display, but they are not interchangeable. The repair process, however, is the same as documented in previous posts. To begin, PCB #11 and the bezel are removed to access the display for desoldering.

item.title: Sections and Accounts for Forecasting
item.description: Forecaster uses Lines (or Line Sets) to define which accounts appear in input sets or reports. You can assign these lines to specific cost centers, creating an “override” that tailors the accounts displayed for a particular department’s input set. For example, the Accounting department would only see accounts relevant to their work. We’ve already covered these Forecaster navigation paths: Build»Lines Build»Reports or Report Worksheet Setup»Budgets»Input Set»Overrides You can also create Sections (Setup»Budgets»Sections) to organize your lines in input sets or reports with headers, improving data presentation.
